newsitem.title: USA: Pharmhouse asked to hire investment bank.
newsitem.headline: Pharmhouse asked to hire investment bank.

text.p: Hemisphere Trading Co Inc advised Pharmhouse Corp's board of directors to hire an outside investment bank to help maximize shareholder value, Hemisphere said Thursday in a regulatory filing.
In a letter written January 14 to Pharmhouse, Hemisphere said the share price of $8.875 did not reflect the full value of the company, given management success during the last four quarters.
Hemisphere urged the company to retain an investment bank to boost the stock's value through the acquisition of Pharmhouse by a larger "entity, public or private."
Hemisphere, an investment advisor, is the second shareholder to write a letter to Pharmhouse's board. WisdomTree Associates wrote to the company on January 13.
Hemisphere wrote that the current consolidation environment in the discount drug and general merchandise industry is ideal for boosting the stock's value.
In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Hemisphere said it holds 209,600 common shares in Pharmhouse or 9 percent of its outstanding shares.
